main_definition: A problem is a difficulty or challenge that needs to be solved, which may cause inconvenience or impede progress.

meanings_and_examples.example: The traffic jam on the highway was a big problem this morning.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A difficulty in achieving an expected outcome
meanings_and_examples.example: Running out of time to complete the project is a major problem for me.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An unpleasant or unexpected situation that requires attention
meanings_and_examples.example: The broken dishwasher at home has become quite a problem.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A matter in debate or discussion, often used when referring to complex issues
meanings_and_examples.example: The debate over climate change is a significant global problem.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Something that needs fixing or improvement
meanings_and_examples.example: Reducing pollution is an important environmental problem we must address.
